Name: Shabti of Ankhes(en)ast
Description: Crudely modelled faience shabti, glaze eroded, with a single eye-hieroglyph at front below the arms, for the beginning of the short text naming the deceased as 'the Osiris Ankhes(en)ast'. This would have been one of a large set of figures intended to carry out any heavy labour required of the dead man in the next world.
